page.title: 02THE RURAL LANDSCAPE
page.content: THIS AREA IS PREDOMINANTLY FARMING AND AGRICULTURAL WITH A FEW SPECIALISED LAND USES BASED ON COUNTRY SPORTS LIKE HORSE RIDING AND HORSE TRAINING. THERE IS A TRAINING STABLE AT HOLDENBY NORTH LODGE WHERE A FAMOUS GRAND NATIONAL WINNER WAS TRAINED.THE RATHER EASY TERRAIN IS IDEALLY SUITED TO SUCH ACTIVITIES. SMALL VILLAGES OR HAMLETS EITHER NESTLE INTO THE VALLEYS OR RUN RIBBON-LIKE ALONG THE RIDGES OF THE GENTLE HILLS. HOLDENBY NESTLES ALONGSIDE THE GREAT HOUSE WHICH IS THE DOMINANT FEATURE OF THE LANDSCAPE.THE VILLAGE CHURCH AND SCHOOL ARE NO LONGER USED AS SUCH, BUT THE SCHOOL IS OCCASIONALLY USED AS A VILLAGE HALL. SHEEP GRAZE CONTENTEDLY ABOVE THE VILLAGE AND ARE DISTURBED ONLY BY THE INFREQUENT GROUP OF CHATTERING RIDERS WHO ENJOY A HACK IN THE AREA. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF LOCALS,THERE ARE NO CARS.
